chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Randy L. Thomas was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Randy L. Thomas was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On driver's license and all vehicles titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL.
Credit for 25 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes: To be paid within first 2 years of probation.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA meeting per week and must provide proof of attendance to P&P agent.

State's Settlement Recommendation

Defendant Randy L. Thomas in court with attorney Mary L Burns.  Charles J Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:52 PM. Burns have resolution - enter a guilty plea on count 1 & 2, count 3 & citation to be dismissed. Count 1 - 3 years probation, conditional jail of 365 days, fine of $2985.00, DL suspension 36 months, no consumption of alcohol, absolute sobriety, no entry into taverns or bars, must obtain full time employment of schooling, 200 hours community service, reimburse FOSO $35 for blood draw, 29 days jail credit. State does not stipulate. Court figures the correct amount of jail credit - 25 days. Court dismisses count 3. Thomas pleads guilty to counts 1 & 2. Court goes over waiver of rights and plea questionaire, finds defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea. Court has found factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges guilty. Court informs right to appeal, firearm and voting rights. Court has taken into consideration the statements of defendant and counsel. Court will accept joint recommendation. Apply bond posted to fine and remainder due to be paid through probation. DNA sample submitted to state's data base. Must report to FOSO today. Court sentences the defendant to the following: Count 1 - Imposed and stayed 6 years in Wisconsin Prison System, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, stayed. Place on probation for 3 years, conditional jail time of 365 days (credit for 25 conditional time), fine of $2,985 plus costs due within first 2 years of probation, DL suspension 36 months starting after release, IID installed on all vehicles titled and registered in his name for 36 months after issuance of valid DL, no consumption of alcohol, no entry into taverns or bars, must obtain full time employment or schooling with verbage (3/week), must attend 1 AA/NA meeting per week and submit detailed report, 200 hours community service, reimburse FOSO $35.00 (take from bond) for blood draw, DNA surcharge. 

Count 2 - Court costs only.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Final pre-trial on June 18, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 11:27 AM. Randy Thomas appears in person and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. State - have issue with discovery as just received blood results. State has filed an Amended Information adding the additional PAC charge. Burns has Amended Information, just need new FPT date for stated reasons. Court continues bond, set for another FPT on 6/18/14 at 1:15 PM.

No consumption of alcohol, no operation of a motor vehicle, no entry into any taverns or bars and the defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with any treatment plan.
No consumption of alcohol, no operation of a motor vehicle, no entry into any taverns or bars and the defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with any treatment plan.
Final pre-trial on May 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Called at 10:06 AM. Randy Thomas appears via video from FOSO and his attorney Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by JBC. State - believe the PH is being waived today. Burns and Thomas agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Burns has Information and expects an amended information will be forthcoming once BAC results come back, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas, set for FPT on 5/28/14 at 10:00 AM. Burns - bond - ask for a reduction to $1000 cash bond for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections to lower cash bond. Court amends bond to $1000 cash and $3000 signature bond with same conditions and add that the defendant is to undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with any treatment plan.
Preliminary hearing on April 16, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Called at 10:32 AM. Randy Thomas appears via video from FOSO and his attorney Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns has complaint but has not gone over it with the defendant. Thomas has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Thomas understands charges. Burns waives further reading, requests PH but would like to address bond prior to making decision on waiving time limits. Burns - bond - asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons (signature bond). State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - will consider signature bond if proof of treatment facility - continues bond, set for PH on 4/16/14 at 9:30 AM.
No consumption of alcohol. No entry into any tavern or bar. No operation of a motor vehicle.
Cash bail set.
